keywords.value: The Devil's Diary: Alfred Rosenberg and the Stolen Secrets of the Third Reich (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

lead_paragraph: A new book, “The Devil’s Diary: Alfred Rosenberg and the Stolen Secrets of the Third Reich,” reveals how two men uncovered a Nazi artifact.

headline.print_headline: Tracking an Elusive Diary From Hitler’s Inner Circle
headline.main: Tracking an Elusive Diary From Hitler’s Inner Circle

snippet: A new book, “The Devil’s Diary: Alfred Rosenberg and the Stolen Secrets of the Third Reich,” reveals how two men uncovered a Nazi artifact.
abstract: Former FBI agent Robert K Wittman and journalist David Kinney recount years-long search for diary of Nazi theorist Alfred Ernst Rosenberg in book The Devil's Diary: Alfred Rosenberg and the Stolen Secrets of the Third Reich; handwritten diary, which had been missing since 1946 when author was convicted and executed for war crimes, sheds light on workings of Hitler's inner circle.
